snippet: Its first-round matchup against Canada is the first in France’s illustrious but tumultuous Davis Cup history to be played overseas in the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe.
abstract: French tennis captain Yannick Noah chooses tropical island of Guadeloupe as location for first-round Davis Cup match against Canada; court construction required French to send 900,000 pounds of clay-court material to stadium and logistics of hosting at overseas department have been formidable.
lead_paragraph: Its first-round matchup against Canada is the first in France’s illustrious but tumultuous Davis Cup history to be played overseas in the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe.

headline.main: Distant, Tropical Isle Is Home Court for the French in a Davis Cup Match
headline.print_headline: Distant, Tropical Isle Is Home Court for the French in a Davis Cup Match
